name: Helen Keller International
mission: Guided by our founder’s remarkable legacy, Helen Keller Intl works to improve the lives of people around the world by protecting vision, enhancing nutri...
theoryOfChange: Helen Keller International utilizes the Essential Nutrition Actions (ENA) and Essential Hygiene Actions (EHA) framework as an organizing framework for its strategy to improve maternal, infant, and young child nutrition. This framework provides an operational approach for advocacy, planning, training, and delivering an integrated package of interventions to achieve high coverage and public health impact. Additionally, Helen Keller International has a new organizational strategy called 'Leading Locally, Fortifying Futures' which focuses on leveraging philanthropy, prioritizing local voices, and delivering cost-effective, proven solutions in their core program areas of nutrition, vision, and health. They are committed to building an evidence base for nutrition-sensitive interventions.

components.evidence: Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 37/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

judge_issues.message: Expenses ($103,633,379) exceed revenue ($75,653,633) by 37% - may be drawing down reserves
BBB name 'Helen Keller Intl' may not match 'Helen Keller International' (similarity: 67%)

score_details.score_summary: Helen Keller International earns 60/100 due to strong alignment and moderate impact.

zakat.claim_evidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly)

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a 99.5/100 score for accountability and financial health.
Total revenue for the period was $145,494,796.
The organization manages significant in-kind medicine distribution.
Financial statements confirm the value of donated medicines and program expenses.
The organization accepts general donations and sadaqah to support its mission.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial health and transparency, balanced by a mid-range impact score reflecting the high cost of systemic health interventions.
areas_for_improvement: High cost per beneficiary relative to other global health interventions
Focus on systemic change can result in slower measurable impact compared to direct-service models

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 37/50, the charity shows high donor fit for those interested in global health and vision [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a moderate impact score of 23/50, reflecting a focus on systemic change rather than just immediate relief [1]. While it maintains a high program expense ratio of 82.8%, the cost per beneficiary is calculated at approximately $2,063.76, and the organization is noted for large-scale distribution of donated medicines [5][7].

baseline_narrative.headline: Helen Keller International works to prevent blindness and reduce malnutrition by delivering life-changing health solutions to vulnerable populations worldwide.
strengths: Exceptional financial efficiency with a fundraising cost of only $0.03 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity position with 18.6 months of working capital available
High program expense ratio of 82.8% ensuring the majority of funds reach those in need
baseline_narrative.summary: Founded to carry on the legacy of its namesake, Helen Keller International focuses on protecting vision and enhancing nutrition through large-scale health care programs [1][8]. The organization operates with a high level of transparency, managing a total revenue of $145,494,796 to support its global mission [2][7].

all_citations.quote: Helen Keller Intl works to improve the lives of people around the world by protecting vision, enhancing nutrition
Distributing Vitamin A, Eliminating Diseases of Poverty
Revenue growth from $89M to $145M over three years

all_citations.claim: Africa, Asia, and the United States
all_citations.quote: Areas Served: Asia, United States.. Africa

all_citations.claim: overall score of 99.99.5/100 from Charity Navigator
Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid
all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial health and transparency, balanced by a mid-range impact score reflecting the high cost of systemic health interventions.

areas_for_improvement.context: The average cost of <cite id="17">$2,063.76 per beneficiary</cite> is relatively high for the global health sector, reflecting a focus on complex systemic change over low-cost mass interventions.

With <cite id="18">18.6 months of working capital</cite> reported in some metrics, the charity holds reserves far beyond the industry standard of 1-3 months, suggesting a potential to deploy more funds immediately.

bbb_assessment.summary: Meets all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards for Charity Accountability

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's focus on systemic change and disease elimination often requires higher up-front investment than simple commodity distribution.
risk_factors: <cite id="17">Cost-effectiveness is lower</cite> than top-tier GiveWell-recommended charities
<cite id="18">Excessive liquidity</cite> may indicate a slower pace of fund deployment
case_against.summary: The primary concern for donors is the <cite id="17">high cost per person served</cite> and the <cite id="18">excessive accumulation of net assets</cite> relative to annual spending.

data_gaps: Cost per beneficiary is high but lacks granular program-level breakdown
confidence.notes: Extremely strong data availability across all major rating and reporting platforms.

known_gaps: High cost per beneficiary requires further qualitative context

credibility.explanation: Donors can place high trust in this charity due to its <cite id="12">20/20 BBB standards achievement</cite>, its <cite id="11">Platinum Candid status</cite>, and its <cite id="14">fully independent board</cite>.
credibility.improvement: Credibility is already at a peak level; maintaining current <cite id="11">Candid Platinum</cite> reporting is recommended.

impact.explanation: The charity is highly efficient in its spending, with an <cite id="9">82.8% program ratio</cite>, but the <cite id="17">$2,063.76 cost per beneficiary</cite> limits its impact score compared to lower-cost interventions.
impact.improvement: To improve impact scores, the charity should aim to <cite id="18">reduce working capital reserves</cite> toward 1-18.6 months of working capital to increase immediate service delivery.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade A - Verified outcomes and documented theory of change

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Funds research and local implementation partners to scale health solutions

rich_narrative.headline: Helen Keller International works to prevent blindness and reduce malnutrition by delivering life-changing health solutions to vulnerable populations worldwide.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value long-term institutional stability and want to support large-scale health systems in Muslim-majority African and Asian nations through sadaqah.
donor_motivations: Value a legacy organization with over a century of experience
Prioritize high financial transparency and 4-star ratings
Want to support blindness prevention and malnutrition
Prefer organizations with extremely low fundraising overhead
giving_considerations: Donations support systemic health improvements which take time to manifest
Large cash reserves mean your gift contributes to a very stable long-term fund
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking the absolute highest 'lives saved per dollar' ratio or those specifically looking to fulfill zakat obligations.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade A reflects <cite id="21">9 tracked outcome metrics</cite> and a <cite id="22">documented theory of change</cite> verified by third parties.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The charity uses a systemic change model to integrate nutrition and vision services into local health systems while providing direct interventions like Vitamin A and medicine distribution.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that large-scale health interventions actually result in reduced disease prevalence and improved nutrition.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Despite large reserves, the scale of global malnutrition and preventable blindness allows for significant expansion of current programs.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="8">$0.03 fundraising efficiency</cite> and <cite id="20">111-year operating history</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: More focused on conflict-zone emergency medical relief
similar_organizations.name: Syrian American Medical Society Foundation

similar_organizations.differentiator: Specific geographic focus on Levant region
similar_organizations.name: Palestine Childrens Relief Fund

strengths.detail: The organization demonstrates remarkable fiscal discipline, spending only <cite id="8">$0.03 to raise every $1</cite> in charitable contributions.
A substantial <cite id="9">82.8% of total expenses</cite> are directed toward program services, exceeding the <cite id="10">peer median of 84.6%</cite> for global health organizations.
The charity holds a <cite id="11">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and meets <cite id="12">all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Helen Keller International's financial health is anchored by a <cite id="13">perfect 100 score in Culture & Accountability</cite> from Charity Navigator. This is supported by a <cite id="14">100% independent board of directors</cite> consisting of 31 members, ensuring rigorous oversight of its <cite id="15">$165.5 million in total assets</cite>. Furthermore, the organization maintains <cite id="16">18.6 months of working capital</cite>, providing a massive buffer against economic volatility and ensuring program continuity in high-risk regions.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 1915 to carry on the legacy of its namesake, Helen Keller International has evolved into a global health powerhouse dedicated to <cite id="1">protecting vision and enhancing nutrition</cite> for vulnerable populations. The organization operates at a significant scale, reporting <cite id="2">$145,494,796 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year. Its operations are characterized by a dual focus on immediate health interventions, such as <cite id="3">distributing Vitamin A supplements</cite>, and long-term systemic change to eliminate diseases of poverty. With a <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 27.7%</cite>, the charity has demonstrated robust growth and an ability to absorb increasing levels of funding to expand its reach across <cite id="5">Africa, Asia, and the United States</cite>. The organization is highly regarded for its financial discipline, maintaining an <cite id="6">overall score of 99.99.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, which reflects its commitment to accountability and transparency. While its delivery model often focuses on systemic health improvements, it also manages massive direct-aid logistics, including the distribution of <cite id="7">over $120 million in in-kind medicine</cite> in a single year. For donors seeking a historic institution with a proven track record in global health, Helen Keller International offers a stable and highly efficient platform for sadaqah giving.
